revised_title: Methods of Evaluating Fundamental Coefficients for Vector-Coupled Schrödinger Integrals
tldr: This article describes methods for evaluating the fundamental coefficients required for the expansion of vector-coupled Schrödinger integrals. The authors present efficient procedures for calculating these coefficients and provide a set of values for use in variational treatments of atoms more complex than fluorine. The article also includes expansions of a set of integrals between functions derived from single and double replacements, which are essential for atomic physics and computational chemistry.
